website_summaries.verdict: This is a good value on a hammer holster with a steel cradle designed to keep your hammer from swinging.
pros: Has a cradle design to keep hammer from moving
Heavy enough to handle large hammers
Fits in belts that are up to three inches wide
cons: The metal holder does not curve up very high, meaning your hammer will hang low and may not stay as still as it should

customer_reviews.title: It holds your hammer.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, it's the cheapest hammer belt holder on here. It holds your hammer. The leather is unfinished and only smooth on one side, I put some linseed oil on it to darken it up and help waterproof it.
customer_reviews.author: Pjsteels

customer_reviews.title: Perfect alternative to wearing a tool belt
customer_reviews.text: I love this hammer loop. The price is unbeatable and it takes daily abuse so well it has become a permanent fixture on my belt. Works great for holding all my hammers carpenter and masonry related. Perfect addition to my life cause I always need a hammer and dislike wearing tool belts.
customer_reviews.author: Nik Rustic

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's cheap and light. Holds my hammer just fine, I recommend conditioning it with leather conditioner just to help make it softer. Was kind of hard getting it on the belt but now that it's on my tool belt it works just like any other hammer loop would. Will definitely buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Melville

customer_reviews.title: great for normal hammer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a small sledge hammer and while it definitely does the job, not sure if it is going to hold up over the long run with all that weight. Admittedly, they probably did not design it with the expectation that you would put anything besides a normal hammer in it, but still. If you plan on carrying anything besides a small sledge, it should be more than adequate for your purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. ZHI

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: arrived on time, not much to say these hold hammers. lol. Actually i have them on my hiking belt to hold a machete, a sling shot, and other things like that and they fit in nice, Cant remember what else but I have 4 of them. (none hold a hammer though) lol
customer_reviews.author: kevin k.

customer_reviews.title: CLC 439 Heavy Duty Hammer Holder
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent hammer loop for what it cost. The leather seems to be of good quality so should hold up to regular use and the plated steel loop is slightly angled upward so the hammer doesn't move around as much as it does in my older straight 90-degree loop.
customer_reviews.author: SJK

customer_reviews.title: Versatility Holder
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I use it for my metal detecting sand scoop at the beach. All I need to do was bend the metal holder up a bit and it works great. Well made and sturdy for using the intended use of a hammer. Made in India.
customer_reviews.author: JAK

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great, but they stick staples through the leather to ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great, but they stick staples through the leather to hold the packaging on, which end so up being 4 extra holes in your leather. Kinda disappointed that they would use staples when there’s two belt holes right next to it for a zip tie.
customer_reviews.author: DBAGproductions

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I am just a homeowner that works around the house. This is one of the best additions to my tool collections at a great price point. This works great to never loose your hammer. I would recommend for every homeowner.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis P

customer_reviews.title: Handy and for more than just a hammer
customer_reviews.text: Actually, my belt has a hammer loop so I don't use it for that. It happens to perfectly fit a cheap power drill/screwdriver I got at Ikea for $12 and end up using all the time because it's small and handy. My Ryobi power drill also fits, just barely.
customer_reviews.author: JeffLearman

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Im an ironworker. Climbing around all day. I use it on my harness to hold my 6lb beater. No issues yet. Good for the price so for. (Still keep my beater tethered just in case though).
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat the value!  Always love CLC!
customer_reviews.text: What to say about hammer holder. The cost of this was very cheap, and I have several CLC products I love. This is no exception. It fits well on my tool belt and has shown zero signs of wear in about 3 weeks of almost daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Fabian

customer_reviews.title: It's good guys.
customer_reviews.text: It's a hammer holder. It works. I do construction. It holds hammer, no real worries that it'll drop out while I climb in the rafters.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Works for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: I have another one of these that I have been using about 10 years and still looks like new. So, I bought a couple more for the crew.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.

customer_reviews.title: PRETTY HEAVY DUTY
customer_reviews.text: IT IS BETTER AND STRONGER THAT WHAT I EXPECTED FOR THE PRICE. I WOULD RECOMMEND IT AND I USE A 24oz FRAMING HAMMER
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Rocuba

customer_reviews.title: Not a very good hammer hanger
customer_reviews.text: After only a couple weeks, the leather folds up and catches my hammer just about everytime. Had to cut out part of it just so I could finish my day so no return...
customer_reviews.author: Sean Garrity

customer_reviews.title: I'm giving this 5 stars for price and made of leather.
customer_reviews.text: Others hammer loops are considerably more in price and this is real leather, a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: 00xuser

customer_reviews.title: Really good product
customer_reviews.text: I use mine everyday at work its a must have for me. Its strong and its lightweight .
customer_reviews.author: Oliver bramwell

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it'll hold my Estwing rock hammer pretty well.
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it'll hold my Estwing rock hammer pretty well. I think the hammer will be easier to access from this than from a sheath attached to my belt. The sheath must be unsnapped/velcroed everything I need to use the hammer. This way it's just grab it and use it.
customer_reviews.author: Chrysostom

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what it is
customer_reviews.text: Hammer holders. They hold hammers. They do it well. Leather is nice and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: WGDBatman

customer_reviews.title: Good in limited use
customer_reviews.text: That is not to say that it will break with heavy use, only that I have only used it a few times, but it worked great. It is simple and holds the hammer high on my thigh, near the hip, which i like. Simple and durable design
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Bergeron

customer_reviews.title: Can’t wait to use it.
customer_reviews.text: Seems a great product. Should make lfe easier especially when I am hanging off the scaffolding.
customer_reviews.author: Trundyl

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Excelent, i work in construction and i need one of this to hold my hammer, do what is espected, no need to buy a expensive one that donthe same.
customer_reviews.author: Lepe

customer_reviews.title: Great if you have a preference
customer_reviews.text: Great value, I have a bag that has the holder in a place I dont like. This solves that problem in a cheap effective way
customer_reviews.author: Mina Zaky

customer_reviews.title: Hammers need holding too.
customer_reviews.text: It holds my hammer when I'm not using it. Beats paying some kid to do it. Not heavy duty but not nessasary either.
customer_reviews.author: Tim C.

customer_reviews.title: Works for small drill too
customer_reviews.text: Great. Much better than the little hammer loop built into the CLC tool pouch. I bought this to put on that belt. An added bonus is that a small drill will also fit in this fairly securely.
customer_reviews.author: T Stafford

customer_reviews.title: Good hatchet holder
customer_reviews.text: Overall it serves its purpose efficiently and they are made to last. They do deform a bit on the edges after some use but that is normal and not an issue, after a while I used some snips to cut the excess material on the sides and bottom part and I like it more than ever. I use this everyday.
customer_reviews.author: R.G.

customer_reviews.title: Need to carry your rock hammer eh?
customer_reviews.text: How else do you want to carry your rock hammer? In you pocket, I think not. Will be carrying mine for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy ever
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought it before I had problems with my hammer slipping out of the holder, holds my hammer nice and high great for scaffolding
customer_reviews.author: Ek Tony

customer_reviews.title: Great price and quality
customer_reviews.text: Clc always makes good stuff and this is pretty amazingly cheap and maintains the clc standard
customer_reviews.author: Matthew P.

customer_reviews.title: Very practical product
customer_reviews.text: Use this nearly everyday, coupled with small pouch, no need to strain my back with traditional heavy construction bags
customer_reviews.author: tim e

customer_reviews.title: Moderate Durability
customer_reviews.text: Came as described. Works well after 6 months of moderate use. No problems. It holds my hammer on my belt.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Made in mega country
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used ye it fits a safty harness belt. Will hold a 3lb sledgehammer. Looks sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Hurt

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Carry an axe in it when out felling. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for a great price
customer_reviews.text: As an electrician I don’t use my hammer everyday, but when I do it is great to be able to toss this on my belt and have my hammer easily accessible.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Good product for an excellent price. Seems to be made from durable material and my rock hammer stayed put while hiking.
customer_reviews.author: EOG

customer_reviews.title: Nothing negative to say
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for and just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Not as Shown
customer_reviews.text: I've used the same Mo# on my rough rig for several years to carry a framing axe had expected this item to be the same. Biggest deficiency is that the upward curve of the loop is greatly diminished, to the point of being barely perceptible, allowing the tool to twist about. It needs to keep that honed blade to the rear and could not do that until I had put it in a vise and reworked it. The photo misrepresents this feature. It also rides higher than my last, but this can be seen.
customer_reviews.author: Marcy G. Steinberg

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to my tool belt
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the price, and you dont lose any quality at all. A great addition to my tool belt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: would buy again if I ever need another.
customer_reviews.text: designed for long and hard use, very strong and nice quality.
customer_reviews.author: s.m.j.

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my tool bags
customer_reviews.text: I use a 24 oz eastwing framing hammer. Fits perfect, dosnt swing and hit the back of my legs.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: But as gift from my coworker for Christmas they love it so really glad I purchase them!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Toston Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Came early. Great product, especially for price. Very nice ,looks wise.
customer_reviews.author: Chad_N_Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Does it’s job. Worried about how long it will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Durable, Slightly too Large for some small Hammers
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my uses, though may be a bit big for some small older hammers
customer_reviews.author: JoadBowie

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: Holds my hammer higher up on my tool belt so it doesn't bang around my knees like it does with the hammer rings on my pouch. After a few months, hardly any sign of being used even though it has been pretty hard.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Dailey

customer_reviews.title: Ripped
customer_reviews.text: Did not last, ripped out with very little use. Synthetic is likely a better choice.
customer_reviews.author: greg kiger

customer_reviews.title: It has one job and it works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes you dont need a full toolbelt but do need a place to hold your hammer while you nail in siding. This has been nice to have.
customer_reviews.author: James Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Quality and value top notch
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product that you can't get at the big box store anymore. Does it's job and hubby is happy.
customer_reviews.author: Hapycurls

customer_reviews.title: Great holder!
customer_reviews.text: I'm just a home handyman so I can't speak for the pros but I really like this holder, especially when I'm working on a ladder. I used to lay my hammer on the top of the ladder or one of the steps-- nice way to get beaned!! This fixed that nicely!
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Doro

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very useful for people who need a hammer constantly. Can fit all sorts of hammers.
customer_reviews.author: gofo5900

customer_reviews.title: I can’t ask for more
customer_reviews.text: I’m glad I bought those product and it’s not even that expensive
customer_reviews.author: Albergaso619

customer_reviews.title: True Value!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made & a great price. You won’t go wrong with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: woody

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to hold a bush axe on my belt. Exactly what I was expecting. Staples are in the leather, else 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Buju  B.

customer_reviews.title: It does what it is supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: Uhh it’s a hammer hook. I needed to keep my hammer on my belt. Now I can. End of review. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: W. Kertland

customer_reviews.title: Always there when you need it
customer_reviews.text: It's always there when you need it, and you always will need it. Sturdy, easy access, draws almost faster than my Glock...BANG !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly whtje addition to my tool belt I was looking for. Quality product at great price. I would definitely buy this again or recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Dominick DeRaimo

customer_reviews.title: WELL WORTH IT
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and sturdy hammer holster. That’s all you need to know
customer_reviews.author: Shaun McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Fix it Felix!
customer_reviews.text: Used it for a Fix it Felix costume and worked great!
customer_reviews.author: JVCJr

customer_reviews.title: Functional, Inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: It will keep my hammer in reach, which is why I bought it. It wasn't too expensive and seems to work fine. Only time will tell how well it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Has lasted months of full time Construction. Cant beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fits nice an snug on the proper belt and doesn't move ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what is expected. It holds your hammer, fits nice an snug on the proper belt and doesn't move around once belt is on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Hammer Holder
customer_reviews.text: I use this hammer holder while Im at work (construction) and it is by far the best hammer holder Ive ever used. The last one I had warped and when I pulled my hammer it would catch and I would have to fumble with my hammer. I got this one and its beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Landry

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality. Openings are just big enough for a ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality. Openings are just big enough for a 2" belt and buckle. Cant beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: beatfreak47

customer_reviews.title: Hammer Holder
customer_reviews.text: I buy these hammer holders whenever i need one, they work good at a reasonable price and last for months.
customer_reviews.author: California

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my hammer in place like it's supposed to and its of great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rent-A-Swagg

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well had it for about a year now, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Your not getting 6
customer_reviews.text: Holder works great but not sure why they call it a "6 PACK", your only getting one of these but they do work great.
customer_reviews.author: Washington Rambo

customer_reviews.title: The hammer loop i am really disappointed in. In the first week
customer_reviews.text: The hammer loop i am really disappointed in. In the first week, somehow one of the rivets pulled through the leather. Yet i have a cheap Husky that lasted for 4 years or so now ...
customer_reviews.author: Joe D.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Way better that that bag i had. Well made product!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Nice leather quality and for the price point can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Keevon Davis -Burney

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of big. I thought it would hold things a bit more snug. That said though It is really well built and does the job quite well.
customer_reviews.author: casey poe

customer_reviews.title: It worked fine with my Plumb hammer, but not with my Eastwing hammer.
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine with my Plumb hammer, but not with my Eastwing hammer. The claw of the Eastwing would often jam on the metal ring I eventually tossed the Leathercraft and purchased a Klein Tools 5456 Leather Hammer Holder. No problems with the Klein.
customer_reviews.author: 95Z28A4

customer_reviews.title: hammer holder
customer_reviews.text: product works great just like it should. leather doesn't tear and loop does not come out of leather. works good for any hammer
customer_reviews.author: slayro89

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The "cradle" in the loop is not as pronounced as pictured. The one that this is supposed to replace has a greater upward sweep that is designed to keep the hammer head in place. Further, the gauge of the steel used in the loop is not as heavy as my original. I may remove the loop from my original holder and rivet it to the leather on from the new one. Not a heavy duty quality product for a professional.
customer_reviews.author: EastPalmBeach

customer_reviews.title: waste of cow hide
customer_reviews.text: its ok when its ok...but i slightly fell on my butt from a flipping bucket and somehow this thing bent and snapped off. I barely felt the fall but this thing suffered..waste of cow hide
customer_reviews.author: Thundergy

customer_reviews.title: Definitely would buy again
customer_reviews.text: My husband is really enjoying this he even recommended to his coworker
customer_reviews.author: lizeth

product_meta.title: CLC Custom Leathercraft 439 Heavy Duty Steel Loop Hammer Holder
product_meta.description: A superior quality hammer holder with a riveted, cradle-style steel loop.
feature_bullets: Fits belts up to two and three quarter inches wide
